tokensOfLine.text: In English, an example of the ongoing participle is the word “running.”
The ongoing participle can be used to make sentences like “I am running,” or “I was running.”
The ongoing participle is sometimes called “the present tense,” (or לְשׁוֹן הוֹוֶה
), and that is an acceptable way of thinking about it for a beginner.
